page.title: 02HISTORY OF RANBY 1891
page.content: GREAT AND LITTLE MORTON AND MORTON GRANGE, 1 MILE SOUTH AND UPPER MORTON GRANGE 3 MILES SOUTH WEST ARE HAMLETS. RANBY IS A HAMLET, PARTLY IN BABWORTH 2 MILES TO THE WEST, WITH A STATION NAMED CHEQUER HOUSE ON THE MANCHESTER, SHEFFIELD AND LINCOLNSHIRE RAILWAY SITUATED 1 MILE SOUTH WEST. MORTON HILL IS HALF A MILE SOUTH EAST OF CHEQUER STATION. MRS SARAH WELLS WAS THE SUB POSTMISTRESS OF THE POST OFFICE AT RANBY. THE LETTERS ARRIVE FROM RETFORD AT ABOUT 8.30AM AND WERE DISPATCHED AT 5PM ON WEEKDAYS ONLY. RETFORD IS THE NEAREST MONEY ORDER AND TELEGRAPH OFFICE RANBY SCHOOL ERECTED FOR 80 CHILDREN WITH AN AVERAGE ATTENDANCE OF 51. THE HEADMISTRESS WAS A MISS ANNIE WOOD COOPE.THE CONSTABLE WAS DAVID DONNER.
